elements.title: Fakemon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that fan-made Fakemon (example pictured) have been confused for genuine unreleased Pokémon?

elements.title: Candlemas Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that plants grow around volcanic gas vents on Candlemas Island?

elements.title: community now known as Loybas Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ranchers in the community now known as Loybas Hill ran their own telephone company for 60 years?

elements.title: August 2014 United States floods (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the August 2014 United States floods set rainfall records across cities in several states, including Michigan, Maine, and New York?

elements.title: 8000th episode (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Jacqui Purvis performed her character's wedding vows in te reo Māori during the 8000th episode of Home and Away?

elements.title: long COVID (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 6 percent of the US population had symptoms of long COVID lasting three months or longer in the first half of 2023?

elements.title: solar eclipse of November 22, 1900 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a newspaper in Kentucky reported that the solar eclipse of November 22, 1900, would pass over Austria instead of Australia?

elements.title: The Butchering Art (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Butchering Art describes how Joseph Lister's successful surgery on Queen Victoria led to the widespread adoption of his antiseptic techniques?
